Overall: 10/10

I can hope for a new season to clear out some of the mysteries of this series, but, overall, it is simply amazing and deep and insightful, with a great artwork and an amazing soundtrack, wonderful characters and a unique story.

Death Parade is visually gorgeous and has a fantastic premise that you'll absolutely enjoy while it lasts, but it never fully explores it, as this is one of those highly uncommon cases where the anime is too short. Had they gone for 18-24 ish episodes you'd be looking at a masterpiece.
Art-
The art is one of the two areas of Death Parade one could argue to be its strongest point. This anime is visually gorgeous, period. Several unique instances gave me that in awe and dazzled feeling, but my overall favorite has to be the billiards game, which had my jaw on the floor and standsout in my mind as one of the most gorgeous and visually impressive moments I've ever seen in any anime. You'll understand when you see it...


Sound-


Death Parade has one of the best intro sequences I've ever seen. Beyond that, the soundtrack is very average and none of the tracks feel memorable to me after the fact. This is perhaps the weakest point of the show other than being too short. There isn't anything wrong with the soundtrack, but there isn't anything special about it either.


The voice acting was quite good and includes a number of names you're likely familiar with from other anime. While no one's performance blew me away, I don't have any complaints in this department whatsoever.


Character-


The individual characters were interesting, but many of them were never properly developed, as they simply did not have enough time to do so. Some characters I was particularly interested in were not even introduced until several episodes in and when the anime is only 12 episodes in total that simply doesn't leave a ton of time to go too deep into the backstories of characters other than the leads. I strongly believe this anime should have been a bit longer and gone a bit deeper with these characters and this is, in my opinion, this anime's biggest shortcoming.


The story is largely the same deal. Great premise, very interesting and easy to get sucked in, genuinely interesting and fascinating to watch but simply not given enough time to play out. Again, more episodes would have done this show a lot of good.


Enjoyment-


I enjoyed damn near every minute of what I got to watch, but I don't feel I got to watch enough, which is both a good and a bad thing. Feeling like you want more probably means what you watched was really good, which it was. But, on the flip side of that coin, it also probably means things were left unanswered or underdeveloped and the show didn't fulfill the entirety of its potential, which is also true. Regardless, with the high overall quality of this show it's one well worth watching.


Overall-


Awesome while it lasts but a bit too short, Death Parade is a gorgeous, high quality ride worth taking.


+Visually gorgeous, period

+Super interesting and enjoyable premise

+Original and cool characters and setting


-Too short, and as such both the characters and the story itself are not as developed as they otherwise could have been


OBJECTIVE RATING- 9

PERSONAL ENJOYMENT RATING- 8

This is by far one of my most favoured anime's, probably of all time. The storyline is original, and the way that the characters are is really unique. I especially love Decim - a cool, and an outright character, that is simply likeable. Not only the characters are great, but also the way that each person has a death "chosen" specifically towards them, depending on who they are and so on. This really helped to make the show interesting, until the end even though the setting is almost constant throughout. Finally, I cannot help but to comment on the soundtrack. Yes, I know I'm surea lot of people have commented on the use of music in this series, but I cannot help myself - It's simply AMAZING! Honestly, it's just so catchy, and I can't deny I found myself listening back to it. Just one more thing, it's a bit of a shame that there isn't a second season. I think that maybe that way, another season could have just focused on explaining the main character's backgrounds in more detail.
